name: widespread but
description:
This is 'widespread but', a new video game from Outhouse Media. As mentioned previously in our June release, we commissioned the developers of Paolomita and Cursed Soul to pen and design the game and bring it to life. After analyzing the game's world, these two designers took on the task of creating the graphics of the game, based on the real world.
The result is a beautiful tiled world that is filled with organic, flowing mazes and flowing islands. The landscape is made entirely of procedural grass, trees, and shrubs, which helps to create a feeling of living in the game. It's charming and the world is alive and alive with natural beauty. The world is divided into six regions, each of which is given its own area based on its biome. This is especially welcome in game development as this allows developers to control their own landscape in a way that was not possible in the real world. The tiled nature of the game also allows for scenic interiors to be rendered which can help to create more dramatic and believable environments. In addition, the tiles are high resolution, allowing for great resolution setting you to see the forest and village scenes. The tiled world also houses a unique scene, the 'Elevator'. This is an impossibly tall place which has never been seen in any other game. Since it is not a door or door frame, it will appear to be floating in the air without any real physical object behind it.
